alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Dawson; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:10AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Barrow, Forsyth, northeastern Gwinnett, southeastern Dawson, Hall and northwestern Jackson Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 110 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from McKee to Cumming to near Alpharetta, and moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Jefferson, Cumming, Dawsonville, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford, Braselton, Auburn, Flowery Branch, Oakwood, Lula, Hoschton, Pendergrass, Gillsville, Talmo, Rest Haven, Dougherty, Candler and Drew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for north central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Barrow; Dawson; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson
